definition: to wait/to inquire after/to watch/season/climate/(old) period of five days
erhua variant of 小時候|小时候[xiao3 shi2 hou5]

sentences.english: He never climbed trees as a boy because he was afraid that he would fall.
sentences.chinese: 他小時候從未爬過樹，因爲他怕跌下來。

sentences.english: As a boy, he used to work in a small shop.
sentences.chinese: 他小時候在一家小鋪裏做工。

sentences.english: Growing up in a family of musicians, he was saturated with music at an early age.
sentences.chinese: 他在音樂世家長大，小時候就飽受音樂薰陶。

sentences.english: When I was young I always daydreamed.
sentences.chinese: 我小時候經常做白日夢。

sentences.english: I often visited The Gables when I was a boy.
sentences.chinese: 我小時候常去“山牆莊園”作客。

sentences.english: In my childhood, I used to frighten little sister by telling her a wolf was coming.
sentences.chinese: 小時候，我總告訴妹妹狼來了，把她嚇得直哭。

sentences.english: Which is sort of a childhood nursery rhyme. And then they cut to this pig and a car with two pin wheels,
sentences.chinese: 這是小時候的兒歌。然後鏡頭切換到豬和有風車的車，

sentences.english: I was very fascinated with meteorology at a young age.
sentences.chinese: 小時候我曾對氣象學非常着迷。

sentences.english: I remember as a child seeing them through my small backyard refractor and it was unmistakable.
sentences.chinese: 我記得小時候用我的小折射鏡看它們，是如此的明顯。

sentences.english: Liuchi gets this from the education and instruction that he got from his parents in his childhood.
sentences.chinese: 劉馳的這一性格得益於小時候父母對他的教育和引導。

sentences.english: When you were child you learned alphabets first, right?
sentences.chinese: 再你小時候你首先學會字母表，對嗎？

sentences.english: B: I used to bite my toenails when I was younger but now I don’t.
sentences.chinese: 我小時候常咬腳指甲，但現在不了。

sentences.english: I broke my nose as a child - it was something with some wild pranks, I guess.
sentences.chinese: 我小時候弄斷過我的鼻子，就是一些小孩子的惡作劇。

sentences.english: Our parents used to remind us to put our toys away when we were done with them.
sentences.chinese: 小時候，父母總是叮囑我們玩了玩具之後要收好。

sentences.english: Jacob: We used to make mud pies when we were little.
sentences.chinese: 我們小時候常一起玩泥餑餑。

sentences.english: We used to make mud pies when we were little.
sentences.chinese: 我們小時候常一起玩泥餑餑。

definition: once/already/former/previously/ever/(past tense marker used before verb or clause)
in those days/then/in those years/during that time
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)

that one/that thing/that (as opposed to this)/(used before a verb or adjective for emphasis)/(used to humorously or indirectly refer to sth embarrassing, funny etc, or when one can't think of the right word)/(used in speech as a filler, similar to "umm", "you know" etc)/(euph.) menstruation/sex/also pr. [nei4 ge5]
